auth.question: Which online sources do you trust?
auth.mainText: Source Checker is an online tool for lessons in which students vote on the credibility of real Internet content. A YouTube video, an Instagram post or an article from an unknown news site - which sources do young people trust and which do they trust less? Source checkers are a fun way to find out. The aim is to provide an easy introduction to the topic of information and news literacy and to examine the credibility of different internet sources.

input.incorrectType: Wrong character type - use digits only

footer.header: The source checker is a project by

chooseAction.header: What would you like to do?

newSurvey.labelTextOne: Should students have the option to choose their own user names? If this option is deactivated, students are automatically assigned numbers.
newSurvey.labelTextTwo: Should the names be displayed in the results shown to the students? If no, only the cumulative results are displayed.
newSurvey.ratingText: In this type of survey, students have to rate the given pages according to trustworthiness. This is done using a scale of 1 - 5 stars (not trustworthy - trustworthy)
newSurvey.warningText: The data cannot be changed later!

undefined.errMsg: Make sure that the Internet connection is established so that you can continue.

404.errMsg: It seems that the request is incorrect. Please try one of the following options:

422.errMsg: It seems that the contents of the request cannot be processed. Please try one of the following options:

500.errMsg: We are currently experiencing problems with our servers.
500.optionOne: Our team is aware of the problem and is working to fix it as soon as possible.
500.optionTwo: Please try refreshing the page or try again later.

saveSurvey.deleteText: Do you really want to delete the survey?
saveSurvey.info: Survey is automatically deleted after 14 days.
saveSurvey.thirdInfo: Keep them in a safe place. Resetting is not possible.

addPages.notiHeader: No pages have been added to this survey yet.
addPages.notiText: Add a link from any source to be able to start a survey.

sideBar.header: Select one view at a time

studentAuth.header: Source checker: Do you trust it?

introText.first: Imagine someone sends you a link via WhatsApp or you see a news item in a story.
introText.second: Your first impression counts: Do you trust it?
introText.third: You can now see a few examples of very different websites and social media apps.

studentSurvey.notStartedInfo: Wait a minute, the survey is about to start.
studentSurvey.title: rate the following source with stars!
studentSurvey.thankYou: Thank you for taking part in the survey!
studentSurvey.ratedInfo: You have evaluated the sources in different ways.
studentSurvey.savedInfo: Your results have been saved successfully.
